title: Fundamental Rights
content: The State shall not deny to any person equality before the law or the equal protection of the laws within the territory of India.

title: Right to Equality
content: The State shall not discriminate against any citizen on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth.

title: Right to Freedom
content: All citizens shall have the right to freedom of speech and expression, assembly, association, movement, residence and profession.

title: Right against Exploitation
content: Prohibition of traffic in human beings and forced labour.

title: Right to Freedom of Religion
content: Freedom of conscience and free profession, practice and propagation of religion.

title: Cultural and Educational Rights
content: All minorities shall have the right to establish and administer educational institutions of their choice.

title: Right to Constitutional Remedies
content: The right to move the Supreme Court by appropriate proceedings for the enforcement of the rights conferred by this part is guaranteed.

title: Right to Property
content: No person shall be deprived of his property save by authority of law.

title: Right to Education
content: The State shall provide free and compulsory education to all children of the age of six to fourteen years.

title: Right to Work
content: The State shall secure the right to work, to education and to public assistance in cases of unemployment, old age, sickness and disablement.
